meanings.definition: To leave someone or something behind
meanings.sent1: She was deserting her friends at the park.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was deserting his post during the night.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to be deserting its owner for more treats.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the sunset were deserting the sky, leaving it dark.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the campfire was deserting us as the night grew colder.

meanings.sent1: He was deserting his homework to play video games.
meanings.sent2: The CEO was deserting his company in a time of crisis.
meanings.sent3: The cookies were deserting their duty to stay in the jar.
meanings.sent4: The wind was deserting its responsibility to cool down the hot day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher felt like her energy was deserting her during the long class.
